raspilot_implementation.websockets package¶

Submodules¶

raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_channel module¶

class raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_channel.WebsocketChannel(channel_name, dispatcher, private=False, success=<function nop>, failure=<function nop>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Websocket channel used for communication between subscribers.

bind(event_name, callback)[source]¶

Binds and callback for the given event name. :param event_name: event name to bind to :param callback: callback which should be run :return: returns nothing

destroy()[source]¶

Unsubscribes from the channel. :return: returns nothing

dispatch(event_name, message)[source]¶

Run callbacks for the received event. :param event_name: event name of the received event :param message: message which will be dispatched :return: returns nothing

trigger(event_name, message)[source]¶

Publishes the event to the channel. :param event_name: event name of the event :param message: message which should be in the event :return: return True if message was transmitted, False otherwise

raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_channel.nop()[source]¶

raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_connection module¶

class raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_connection.WebsocketConnection(url, dispatcher, username, password)[source]¶

Bases: object

Websocket connection. Used to send, receive messages.

connect()[source]¶

Connects to the server. :return: returns nothing

connection_id¶
disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnects the socket. :return: returns nothing

raw_send(message, success, failure)[source]¶

Sends a raw message via the websocket. If the transmission fails failure callback is executed (if set). If the transmission is successful the success callback is executed (if set). It is not verified that someone receives the message, only transmission success is reported. Callbacks should have one parameter - message. :param message: message to be sent :param success: success callback :param failure: failure callback :return: True if transmission is successful, False otherwise.

reconnect()[source]¶

Reconnects to the server. WebsocketApp is closed, newly created and WebsocketConnection.connect() is called :return: returns nothing

trigger(event)[source]¶

Sends event to the server. If not connected, event is added to the queue. :param event: event to send :return: returns True if message was transmitted, False otherwise

raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_dispatcher module¶

class raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_dispatcher.WebsocketDispatcher(provider, username, password)[source]¶

Bases: object

Dispatcher for the websockets. Main class for work with websockets.

bind(event_name, callback)[source]¶

Binds a callback for a event name. :param event_name: event name to bind :param callback: callback which will be called :return: returns nothing

connect()[source]¶

Connects to the server. :return: returns nothing

connection_id¶
disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnects the websocket. :return: returns nothing

is_connected()[source]¶

Returns True if connected, false otherwise :return: True if connected, false otherwise

is_subscribed(channel_name)[source]¶

Returns True, if given channel name is subscribed, False otherwise. :param channel_name: name of the channel :return: True, if given channel name is subscribed, False otherwise

on_close()[source]¶

Called when connection is closed because of an error, or because of normal disconnect. Notifies the provider. :return: returns nothing

on_error(error)[source]¶

Called when an error occur. Notifies the provider. :param error: error occurred :return: returns nothing

on_new_message(message)[source]¶

Called when new message arrived. Creates a WebsocketEvent from the message and dispatch this event. In case of ‘ping’, events, ‘pong’ is automatically send. In case of ‘client_connected’ event, the connection id is saved.

In case of ‘channel’ event, the message is dispatched to the channel.
Parameters:message – received message
Returns:returns nothing.
on_open()[source]¶

Called when connection is opened. Notifies the provider. :return: returns nothing

raw_send(message, success, failure)[source]¶

Sends a raw message via the websocket. If the transmission fails failure callback is executed (if set). If the transmission is successful the success callback is executed (if set). It is not verified that someone receives the message, only transmission success is reported. Callbacks should have one parameter - message. :param message: message to be sent :param success: success callback :param failure: failure callback :return: True if transmission is successful, False otherwise.

reconnect()[source]¶

Reconnects. :return: returns nothing

should_reconnect()[source]¶

Returns True, if should reconnect, False, otherwise :return: True, if should reconnect, False, otherwise

state¶
subscribe(channel_name, success=<function nop>, failure=<function nop>)[source]¶

Subscribes the public channel. :param channel_name: name of the channel :param success: success callback :param failure: failure callback :return: returns nothing

subscribe_private(channel_name)[source]¶

Subscribes the private channel. :param channel_name: name of the channel :return: returns nothing

trigger(event_name, data, success_callback=<function nop>, failure_callback=<function nop>)[source]¶

Creates event with given name and data sends it. If the event is successfully executed then the success callback is run, otherwise failure callback is run. :param event_name: name for the event :param data: data sent in the event :param success_callback: callback for success :param failure_callback: callback for failure :return: returns nothing

trigger_event(event)[source]¶

Sends event, which was previously created. :param event: event which should be sent :return: returns True if message was transmitted, False otherwise

unsubscribe(channel_name)[source]¶

Unsubscribes the channel. :param channel_name: name of the channel :return: returns nothing

url¶
wait_for_connection()[source]¶

Blocks until connection is successfully created, or till the connection fails. :return: returns nothing

raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_event module¶

class raspilot_implementation.websockets.websocket_event.WebsocketEvent(message, success_callback=<function nop>, failure_callback=<function nop>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Event representation used in the websocket.

channel¶
classmethod create_event(namespace, data)[source]¶

Creates an WebsocketEvent containing the data for regular updates. :param namespace: event namespace (type) under which the data will be transferred :param data: data which should be contained in the event :return: newly created WebsocketEvent with regular data updates

classmethod create_pong(connection_id)[source]¶

Creates a pong event. :param connection_id: id of the current connection :return: newly created pong event

id¶

Returns True if is ping. :return: True if is ping, False otherwise

is_result()[source]¶

Returns True if is result. :return: True if is result, False otherwise

is_success()[source]¶

Returns True if is successful. :return: True if is successful, False otherwise

run_callbacks()[source]¶

Runs the successful callback if is successful and the callback is set, otherwise runs failure callback if the callback is set. :return: returns nothing

success¶

Serializes the event into JSON :return: JSON representation of the event
